column1: On [[25 August]] [[1973]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
*'''Subject:''' A letter of thanks to [[wikipedia:Glyn Daniel
*'''Publication:''' The letter was printed in full in ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: A Biography]]'', pp. 256-7.

column2:
Dear Daniel,

It is a long time since July 20th; but better (I hope) late than never to do what I should have done before being immersed in other matters : to thank you for your delightful dinner in St Johnâ€™s, and especially for your forbearance and great kindness to me personally. It proved a turning point! I suffered no ill effects whatsoever, and have since been able to dispense with most of the diet taboos I had to observe for some six months.

I look forward to the next A.E. dinner, and hope that you will be present.

Yours ever,

Ronald Tolkien.}}
